preqs: Enrolled in the Bachelor of Interior Architecture and must have passed 72 credits

rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {2126%}

description: This unit offers focused study of an aspect of interior architectural production.  This is explored in relation to a range of historic, theoretical, material and speculative domains. Projects may address diverse social, cultural and technological perspectives. The unit will incorporate various methodologies for understanding interior architecture as a series of transformational practices.
faculty: Faculty of Art, Design and Architecture
